etymology.description: 人(人) (rén, "person") + 𥏻(𥏻) (phonetic) = 殳(殳, "weapon") + phonetic 昜(昜, "bright") -> injury; simplified: 昜(昜) replaced by 力(力, "strength")
etymology.interpretation: Originally, the character combined the meaning of a person with a weapon (phono-semantic), suggesting physical injury. In the simplified form, the phonetic 昜(昜) was replaced by 力(力) to create a visually simpler structure while maintaining the concept of harm.
etymology.simplification: The original phonetic 昜(昜) was replaced by 力(力), which provided both a simpler structure and an intuitive association with strength and force related to injury.

examples.chinese: 这次事故造成了严重的伤(這次事故造成了嚴重的傷)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè cì shìgù zàochéng le yánzhòng de shāng.

examples.chinese: 他不小心伤了自己(他不小心傷了自己)，但迅速得到了治疗(但迅速得到了治療)。
examples.pinyin: Tā bù xiǎoxīn shāng le zìjǐ, dàn xùnsù dédào le zhìliáo.
examples.english: He accidentally injured himself, but he quickly received treatment.

examples.chinese: 他的话伤了我的心(他的話傷了我的心)。
examples.pinyin: Tā de huà shāng le wǒ de xīn.
